message_1: Find all solutions of the equation sin(x) = 1/2 in the interval [0, 2ğœ‹].
message_2:
To find all solutions of the equation sin(x) = 1/2 in the interval [0, 2ğœ‹], we need to find the angles x for which the sine function equals 1/2.

We know that sin(ğœ‹/6) = 1/2 and sin(5ğœ‹/6) = 1/2. These are the two angles in the interval [0, ğœ‹] that have a sine value of 1/2. Since the sine function has a period of 2ğœ‹, we can find the other solutions in the interval [ğœ‹, 2ğœ‹] by adding 2ğœ‹ to each of these angles:

sin(ğœ‹/6 + 2ğœ‹) = sin(ğœ‹/6 + 12ğœ‹/6) = sin(13ğœ‹/6) = 1/2
sin(5ğœ‹/6 + 2ğœ‹) = sin(5ğœ‹/6 + 12ğœ‹/6) = sin(17ğœ‹/6) = 1/2

So, the solutions of the equation sin(x) = 1/2 in the interval [0, 2ğœ‹] are:

x = ğœ‹/6, 5ğœ‹/6, 13ğœ‹/6, 17ğœ‹/6
